Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff & hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daithi28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights recently. The hotel is 10 mins walk down a side street to las ramblas & about the same distance to the port. Excellent location for exploring barcelona. Plenty of reasonable little restaraunts in the area. Its in a working class area & you get a real local spanish feel about the area. The rooms are very clean & there are 3 or 4 english speaking channels on the tv there. Breakfast is good too & the staff are very helpful & speak very good english. Lovely hotel, would definetely stay there again & would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ell33
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in this hotel on a short break with friends. Excellent location far away from la Ramblas to avoid the crowd but still within walking distance (be careful of walking down the carrer de Sant Pau at night, we were the subject of several attempts at pick pocketing by the 'friendly' locals). In the daytime this street was fine. The hotel itself is modern and has a gym and sauna (which we didn't use). The room we had was, although small, comfortable and clean. Bathroom was modern with a lovely power shower. We had a rear facing room which looked out onto the rear of another building which wasn't ideal, but then how much time do you actually spend in your room? The bed was comfortable which is all that really matters. The only negative was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities. The staff were polite and helpful, especially on checkout when there was a problem with the rate we were charged for one of the rooms. In fairness to the guys on the desk, they realised the mistake and sorted it quickly for us. A great hotel, one which I'd definitely consider using again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff & room, a little noisy but great value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: Belle260310
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a mini break in Barcelona. The Hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Las Ramblas, you can either head down a slightly dodgy side street to save a couple minutes or walk to the bottom of Las Ramblas and up another main road. The room was lovely and clean with great facilitles and the staff were exceptionally helpful - cannot thank them enough for all their help and advice. The only downside was our room was on the main road and there was not double glazing so quite noisy with sirens and general traffic at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: BlackPanda_12
Reviews.Content: You must use this hotel if you want just a 10 min walk to La Rambla and the Marina area. Excellent location for public tranport routes. The bus stop is directly outside and the Metro (Paral.Lel) is less than a minute walk away. This hotel is small and modern with a lovely roof terrace overlooking the city. It is classed as 4 star but would say it is more 2- 3 star. Clean modern rooms but the beds are very uncomfortable and small. We stayed in a twin room at the back of the hotel which meant there was hardly any street noise but the soundproofing in the hotel is very poor and spent the first 2 nights being kept awake by the loud snores of the man in the next room. I reported this to reception and for the next 2 nights no one else was booked into the room next door. You can hear the rumble of the Metro but this stops at midnight and got used to it after the first night.The sockets in the wall were loose, so extra care had to be taken. The rooms didn't have tea/coffee making facilities which was greatly missed, especially after a long day of sightseeing.The reception staff were very pleasant and the breakfast area looked very inviting although we didn't try it (too expensive) We read a lot of reports prior to arriving in Barcelona stating that the area in which this hotel is situated (El Raval) is somewhere to be desired and can be a bit dodgy. However, we thought it was a great location in order get to all the main sights, there are plenty of bars and places to eat. Thoroughly recommend Los Cachitos on the corner for breakfast and evening meal, Bar Moritz across the street for a drink is cheap and quiet. You will be spoilt for choice. The Sant Antoni market is a 10 minute walk away. As two women travelling together the only time we felt uncomfortable was walking down Carrer de Sant Pau; this can be taken as a short cut from La Rambla to the hotel but half way down the street it felt unsafe and we wouldn't recommend walking down here at night. All in all the local people we very friendly, public transport is frequent, cheap and clean and the city is full of things to see and do. You will not be bored. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for central location”
Reviews.Author: StockholmTom
Reviews.Content: A good hotel for a fairly good price. Located in one of the more rough parts of the old town. The Raval part of old town has perhaps more down and outs but we never felt unsecure. The Guradia Civil has one of its locations close by on the street that leads to La Rambla de Raval, a nice open long plaza in the middle of the Raval quarter on your way to the big La Rambla of central Barcelona. On foot it's about 15 minute walk from hotel to La Rambla in central Barcelona. We never had breakfast in the hotel but ate in the cafes across the street from the hotel which was great. The are did not feel at all touristic but more with a touch of local life. I Can recommend the hotel if you look for a nice place to stay for a city break. We did not use any facilities so I can't say anything about them. The staff of the reception was kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: george h
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and it was good. The staff were excellent and spoke English well. They helped us find some good restaurants in the area that have good sea food and not the touristic ones that will serve less authentic food. The rooms and hotel was very clean and the furnishings looked new and there was nothing broken or anything that needed replacing. It was close to the metro which we recommend taking rather than the bus. The buses are confusing, the metro is very clear and takes you everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelByTips
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the tail end of our honeymoon. Even though we showed up mid-morning on the day of our arrival, they were able to get us checked in early. The hotel and our room were both very clean and we felt like we were the only ones staying there (it was a Monday night, but we only a couple other guests the whole day). The room was small, but fine for us. Our only complaint was noise could be heard through the walls and people on the street could be heard as well during the early parts of the night. The metro was only a block away and the tapas restaurant across the street was great! Would definitely recommend based on our experience despite the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice bathrooms, great breakfasts. !!!”
Reviews.Author: Cupar
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 days in this hotel before picking up cruise ship. Having read the reviews, we were not sure what to expect but found the location very central. Metro was 100 yards away and it was a pleasent 15 min walk to Las Ramblas. The hotel room was a little basic but very clean and the bathrooms excellent. The buffet breakfast was very good and the surrounding area had lots of places to eat. One of the reviews had mentioned not feeling safe about the area but we could not understand this as we walked at night and felt perfectly safe.If wanting to get to the port, take the metro at Paral-lel 1 stop to Drassanes ,cross the Colon roundabout and the pickup bus takes you to the ship.for a cost of 3 euro each. much cheaper than a taxi. I would recommend staying here for a couple of nights as a good medium range hotel but if staying longer I would maybe want a larger hotel with more amenities but we were very pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ok experience with a few problems”
Reviews.Author: squigs55
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine overall. They booked us in quickly enough but in doing so offered none of the extras that are advertised. (Think this is common - see other reviews). In fact they hardly spoke to us at all when doing this - but were quick and efficient anyway. During our stay the toilet broke and we had to lift the lid off to flush the system. This was pointed out to management and a token effort was made to fix it - this failed. When asked about it again they stated their maintance person was off the weekends and so it could not be fixed to monday! A room change was only offered on the last day of our stay. The location of the hotel was good. A short five / ten minute walk from one of the main tourist areas - it was therefore close to sightseeing bus routes. It was also fairly close to the train system. Some of the areas directly around the hotel looked run down but as we avoided them at night and only briefly walked through on two days they didn't pose any problems that some other reviewers have hinted at. Hint - if staying there and intenting to walk a lot, always head down in the direction of the harbour first, the main roads are safe enough.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here! Terrible Service, Bad Neighbourhood.”
Reviews.Author: grantleriche
Reviews.Content: Service: Facilities are open until 9pm*, but for some strange reason, you have to make an appt to use the gym. And by 9pm, I mean, they close at 8pm or even earlier if you don't make an appt. Don't try arguing with them that it's supposed to still be open, they don't care. Area: When asking how to get the main strip, they advised to take a detour a few streets down, as the neighbourhood behind the hotel is very crime ridden. Proof of this is when I was eating dinner a block down on a patio, and got robbed by 2 guys. Rooms: Fairly clean, but small, not worth the money. There are WAY better hotels for this money. Trust me, and spend that extra $20 / night. It's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Dont ask the reception to order you a taxi”
Reviews.Author: GEO4181
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel however the area is a bit seedy to say the least. It is a 10 minute walk to las rambles. I would eat and drink off the street as you can get very good eating places at a reasonable price. I asked the reception to order me a taxi and the price was 5 euros over the initial price that I paid in the first instance. Nice people at reception however they have their taxis for profit.Watch out for the pick pockets, I was tried however as I was from Glasgow they got more than they bargained for.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff and clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: bluwaterz
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit small, but our big windows opened up onto the street and it was fun watching all the activity. Clean, modern room was a tight squeeze, but the free internet made up for the inconvenience. Very close to Metro and also walkable from many must-see areas of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: magicmat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easily located. Very friendly useful staff. My room was of an adiquate size and facilities, with wireless access....which was great, when it worked. Both nights it suffered problems disconecting though, very frustrating. The spa facilities were reasonably good, you have to book your slot, and you get private use. The jacuzzi was quite nice, but not particularly warm, with a flat base, no seats. However i enjoyed having a bit of chill out time in here. The roof garden looked nice, but I wasetn going to use it in Feb! I felt reasonably safe, but all the warning of likely pickpockets were a bit concerning! Very close to La Ramblas, a short walk to the harbour, and very very close to the undergound - great location. For my uses, this hotel was brilliant, and very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel doesn't offer refunds ... even during strike with no way to get there”
Reviews.Author: cruiserfromnj
Reviews.Content: Planned on staying at Acta Millenni both before and after my European Cruise. Unfortunately, the day I flew out, there were strikes all over Europe. I could not even fly into Barcelona, I had to fly into Paris and was going to take a train down to Barcelona (when I left the trains were still going). However, when we got to Paris, all transportation to Spain was on strike and could not get down to the hotel. Acta acknowledged they were aware of this but did not care and would not refund my money. On top of that I had three rooms booked under my name for that night so I'm out the cost of three rooms. Since it was two weeks to my return, I cancelled the second reservation and we found a great Holiday Inn to stay at in Barcelona, close to everything. After reading others reviews about the unsafe conditions of this hotel, I'm glad I didn't have to stay here, however, that being said, knowing the strikes prevented me from getting there and I was trying to cancel a day in advance, the hotel should not have charged me.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be re-rated, definitely not a 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: Patriciaychou
Reviews.Content: Our first time visiting Spain and it wasn't a pleasurable trip. 2nd day into Barcelona and we got pick pocketed on Las Ramblas in broad daylight and spent the rest of the afternoon making a police report at the station which was pointless. Staying at this hotel wasn't any better. We booked a family room but it turns out to be an ordinary room with a pull out cot at the corner. The decor & bathrooms were outdated. Housekeeping keeps forgetting to restock the toiletries and once forgot to wash the tub & basin coz there were hair & sand leftover from our trip to the beach the previous day. The front desk staff were not very friendly nor helpful, one was extremely rude and didn't like the fact that my kids used their business center to check emails. They refuse to break my bill for change when I told them I didn't have any smaller bills on me since getting robbed. They do not provide adapters for computers/chargers or have a descent map of Barcelona for their guests. Basically, don't expect any service. I didn't mind the walk which did concern me when I first read the reviews about this hotel, but I wouldn't recommend going out too late at night as the area didn't look too safe. I am glad I didn't book the hotel breakfast as there's lots of inexpensive cafes nearby. The bus and metro are also very close, if needed. The only pros about this hotel is that they have a cute solarium and jacuzzi on the top deck, as well as, a spa center down in the basement which was very private and requires advance reservation. If I were to return back to Barcelona in the future, I would definitely NOT stay at this hotel and pay more for better service, location & a descent room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel - don't be taken by these reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: KristinDenver
Reviews.Content: We travel frequently, and just returned from a three night stay at Acta Milleni a few days ago. The hotel is in a very unsafe area - lots of drugs and prostitution immediately behind the hotel, and even the desk staff warned against walking through the area - day or night. Our triple room was triangular, tiny, and there were two twin beds and one cot shoved together so that they would all fit. Had to store our suitcases in closet just to have room to walk on the floor! Beds were hard as bricks. Rooftop hot tub and deck open at 9:30 a.m. and close at 7:00 - no exception - so can't even enjoy a soak after walking around the city. Other reviews that say it is far from everything are totally correct!! We had to take city transportation (which was close, that was the only positive) or the tourist bus (which was okay) to get to ANYTHING that is on a tourist list. Do NOT stay at this hotel for any reason!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location, but break out your walking shoes”
Reviews.Author: agedude
Reviews.Content: Booked a "Standard" room on Expedia for $112 a night versus an "economy" for $104. Didn't realize until check-in my Expedia receipt says "Double Room" without specifying standard or economy. Desk tried to give me an economy room but immediately switched to standard when I explained the mistake. Nice hotel on the edge of central Barcelona. Probably a little over a mile walk to the Ramblas. Modern interior with a fair amount of room. Nice bathroom with large sink and plenty of counter space. The bathtub is a tub in name only. Too small to bathe in but fine for a shower. Two single beds pushed together make a king-sized bed so plenty of room to sleep. Small 20" flat screen TV with BBC World news and MSNBC for English speakers and free internet access. Interior room was very quiet without traffic noise. Definitely worth extra $8 for a larger room. Walked to Ramblas, Barri Gothic, and Picasso museum so it's not that far out of town. Very close to Parel-lel metro stop. Easy arrival by plane, took Aerobus A1 to Placa Espanya, 20 meters to metro station, and Paral-lel is two stops away. Front desk staff was very helpful. Located in a decent but not great neighborhood with several restaurants, a fruit and supermarket within a 5 minute walk. Great place to stay while saving $100 per night off more central locations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nestorex
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel close to Paral-lel subway station. This is not the cheapest hotel, but they often have special offers which make the room price attractive. Our room was cleaned regularly, there was a minibar, air conditioning and a safe. The bed was comfort, and we found extra pillows conveniently in our closet. The rooms vary a lot in size, the building has a peculiar shape. We had a big room with a king size bathroom. There was also a small balcony. Our room faced the street, but there was surprisingly little traffic noise. There was some noise coming from the broom closet next to our room. Don't forget the check out the roof terrace, lovely view over Barcelona! Wireless internet access, air conditioning and safe deposit box were at our disposal free of charge. I will not give the room five stars, because the signal for wireless internet was weak from time to time. I got often cut off, when someone walked in the corridor. The room price includes a private, one-hour usage of a jacuzzi. Make sure to book it at the reception. Breakfast was lovely, continental and catalonian food filled buffet. It's not included in the room price. It's quite expensive unless you pre-order it from the internet as you book you room. The hotel staff was friendly and professional and they spoke many languages. Not a big deal, but I have to give them a little thumbs down for two things: they were not keen to offer any of their services, like jacuzzi, gym or breakfast. I*m not sure if all the guests realize they are entitled to little extra services, they only mention those on their website. No booklet in the room. There was also a mix up at check-out. I took advantage of a special offer for both the room and the breakfast. The bill was printed out for full price, even though I presented my reservation code when i checked in. Luckily I had printed out my reservation. The bill was corrected quickly and we did not miss our flight back home. Acta Millenni is a good choice, if you don't need all the luxury in the world, but will appreciate a classy, modern, beautiful hotel. it was definitely nothing like a student dorm or a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: newtonmatraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night prior to leaving on a cruise. Although the hotel is centrally located, it does not have much else to like. We found the staff okay, but not overly helpful or friendly. The rooms are very small and from what we could see did not have air conditioning. We had one of the family suites that fundamentally had no windows, was hot (even though it was cool outside), and located on a balcony above the dining room, making it noisy in the morning. We arrived at about 11:35 for breakfast that ended at 11:30 and were turned away even though the buffet was all set out. We could not even get a cup of coffee. After the cruise we stayed at the hotel fira palace which is just a few blocks away. It was a much better hotel and better value. Try there rather than here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Friendly Staff at Millenni”
Reviews.Author: OhioEmilyOhio
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of an Expedia package. Based our choice on traveler reviews--we wanted a clean, quiet place with good access to public transport and close to most major sights. Hotel was very easy to access using Metro lines. It´s within 100 meters of a metro station. It only takes 5-10 minutes to walk to La Rambla and another 5 minutes from La Rambla to get to Barri Gotic. The hotel is very clean. The rooms are modest -- about the size of dorm rooms. We had to change rooms after two nights because our first room faced busy Ronda Sant Pau. From our bed, it sounded like people were literally standing in our room having a conversation. The traffic was really loud. We didn´t sleep very well at all. Having said that, we had no problems transferring to an interior room. The new room was much quieter. We did have to sacrifice our large bed for two twins, the twin beds are pushed together though so it might as well have been a double. The staff is very nice. They speak English well and have been able to answer all of our questions. They even provided us with corkscrew so we could open our bottle of wine. I would recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to be able to walk to the major sites, doesn´t mind modest accomodation, and appreciates a clean place. We give this an above average rating because it´s definitely a clean place with friendly staff and quiet (if you´re in the right room). We did not give a higher rating because the rooms are a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fab Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Slinks
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband have just spent a couple of days here for our 10th wedding anniversary and it was absolutely brill. The hotel has spared no expense on decor, furnishings, etc., and the soluarium with the hot tub was an absolute treat. The staff were very friendly and helpful [the reception staff were all attractive men dressed in very smart suits which made a nice change!] The hotel is about two blocks [10-15 minute walk] from Las Ramblas and there's a supermarket across the road which was handy. The room had a minibar which was filled with all you could need in drinks and snacks. Would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: photojean
Reviews.Content: We arrived early evening for a one night stay prior to a cruise . The staff made us very welcome & provided us with a city map & details on how to keep ourselves & our personal belongings safe. Our hotel bedroom & bathroom were spotlessly clean, and we found several very useful accessories had been left for us, e.g. travel toothpaste & brush, shower cap, soap, shower gel. comb, shoe clean kit etc. There was no outlook from the window, but this was not a problem. Stepping out into the street we found several bars & restaurants & enjoyed a nice evening with very little interference from street sellers. We enjoyed a very good hotel buffet breakfast which was priced at 15euros each, plenty of choice & served in an immaculate dining room. The hotel is situated within a short distance of La Ramblas & we walked there the next morning. (Would not recommend walking through the back streets at night). We were able to leave our luggage in our room until midday so we found this very convenient. Having read poor reviews for this hotel we were delighted to stay in such a comfortable and well run establishment & can certainly recommend it. We will be happy to stay here again when next in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot see why people are complaining about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jl82
Reviews.Content: I have to say that after reading some of the less than complementary comments on here I was expecting a dirty hotel with muggers on every corner about a hostel level. The hotel may not be a 4 star standard Dubai standard but I have to say I have stayed in 4 star hotels in London that would never compare to this lovely hotel. Reception was inviting and as one person pointed out the bar does close at 9pm but what is the problem there are many lovely restaurants nearby. In fact the receptionist pointed us to a lovely place that was not expensive at all. Rooms are comfortable, clean and well maintained. We met up with friends who came back to the hotel for a drink and who had brought us a bottle of champagne to celebrate and the bar staff put it in an ice bucket even though we had not purchased it there. Would definitely recommend this hotel and have to say never saw any muggers or prostitues in this area and only had a beggar hassle us in Ramblas which I would expect.

Reviews.Title: “This is rather a two star hotel !”
Reviews.Author: FreqSurfer
Reviews.Content: 1. The first room they gave me was too noisy from apparently water flowing in pipes. Also it was not properly cleaned as there was a long woman's hair on the wall of the toilet. 2. The second room they gave me was even worse. TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE. The towels they provided were obviously not clean, as I found two long woman's hair on them!! Also the water in the bathtub could not empty easily ! 3. The hotel was way too noisy, mainly from noise created by the cleaning staff !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ice staff!”
Reviews.Author: rp874533
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried abut the area after reading some reviews... HOW WRONG THEY WERE! The hotel was lovely, the area is fine and the staff friendly and helpful. Its a 5 minute walk to the Ramblas and main square down the back streets which were fine in the day (apparently a bit dodgey in the evening so we avoided) and about 15 minutes if you go down the main road. If you dont fancy the walk there's a tube just outside that you can take for 1.3 euros or 10 euros for 2 days unlimited travel( Well worth it if you want to see the whole city!) Anyway book in confidence you'll have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel for weekend break”
Reviews.Author: DPearson
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed at the Apsis Millenium on the 31st Aug - 2nd Sept after reading the reviews on here I was slightly aprehensive about the location of this hotel. On arrival we were impressed with the hotel and the location seemed fine, it's located in the Theatre district so is quite busy in the evenings. We had been told to watch out for pickpockets in Barcelona and the hotel receptionist gave us an information sheet on ways to keep safe in and around the city which was vey heplful, and as when visiting anywhere you just have to be sensible and not take short cuts or walk down little side streets at night, although we did feel safe doing this during the day. Getting to La Ramblas took about 15 minutes and that is sticking to the main route going to the roundabout by the port turning left then just a short walk on another main road and you will be at the bottom of La Ramblas. The rooms in the hotel are not massive but adequate and very clean and comfortable, maid service and towels changed everyday. Air conditioning worked fine for us and as in most spanish hotels the only english channel on the TV was CNN, but who comes to Barcelona to watch TV..... It is worth getting a taxi or walking to Port Olympic as there are some lovely restaurants especially if you like seafood, it's also quite lively late into the evening although some bars can be very expensive. the bus tour of Barcelona is also worth doing 19 euros and you can get on and of as many times as you like until 9pm, also 3 different bus routes, so definatley worth the money. Overall an excellent weekend and we would definatly visit this city and hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit but....”
Reviews.Author: Probus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Milleni between 21st and 23rd July. Overall, we found the hotel to be of a good standard with extremely helpful staff who spoke excellent English - would we go back? Probably. The rooms were clean and pleasant (we stayed on the 5th floor and had no problem with noise from the traffic outside) - and the air conditioning (essential given the temperatures) worked well. Apart from CNN, there were no English language channels on the TV but, to be frank, we spent relatively little time in the room. The breakfast was pretty good, offering a varied selection of excellent quality. There is a rooftop sun terrace and also, it is claimed, a bar but it didn't seem to be open during our visit (not a problem given the proximity to plenty of decent places near by - do try Moritz directly opposite, which does very good tapas). The only problem we had with the hotel was that for the first night we were in close proximity to another guest who was extremely loud, aggressive and seemingly drunk. Luckily, he departed on the second day and the hotel staff were very apologetic. For the rest of the time it was an oasis of calm. The hotel is located in what could best be described as a fairly mixed, residential neighbourhood - not particularly picturesque but with the advantage of making you feel part of the local culture rather than a tourist. The big plus is that is only a 10-15 minute walk from the old port and La Ramblas with other main sites also within walking distance but.....and here is the problem....the shortest direct routes to La Rambas go through Raval which, though better than it was, can still be pretty unpleasant. For example, if you come out of the hotel turn left and walk along Carrer Sant Pau (home to Barcelona's oldest church - worth a visit), particularly near Rambla del Raval, you rapidly realise this is a far from salubrious area with drug addicts and prostitutes visible even at midday. One kindly local warned us as we walked to watch out for muggers! At night-time, I could imagine tourists are easy targets. So, some words of advice - don't carry a bag or have a camera on display and, if walking, go down towards the port and then up La Ramblas from the Columbus monument or take the longer route, via Ronda Sant Pau/Ronda Universitat and come down Las Ramblas from Placa de Catalunya. A couple of other tips - the Bus Turistic offers superb value, allowing you to hop on and off and visit all the main sites. The nearest stops to the hotel are at Place de Catalunya and the Old Port. Barcelona is full of bars and places to eat - for the former, we particularly liked the famous Boadas (just off the top of Las Ramblas); for the latter, Taller de Tapas (Placa Sant Josep) where we could have stayed all day. Also, if in the area of the Old Port, avoid the quite expensive places on the front and visit the top floor restaurant in the Museu d'Historia de Catalunya which has fantastic views over the harbour together with reasonably priced (for the quality) food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous area”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineAscot
Reviews.Content: The Apsis Hotel is situated quite conveniently to the Ramblas - about 10/15 mins walk. Unfortunately the room we had was right on the road and they had no other twin rooms. We booked from 7th June to 11th (Fri - Mon) We are young 50s women and used to travelling. One an ex air hostess, the other a model and dancer. When we arrived as we got into a taxi outside the hotel my girlfriend was mugged viciously. She was pulled back to the pavement and a young man around 23 tried to take her bag. This of course ruined the holiday for us. Another woman in our party was staying in a different hotel The Principal in calle commerc. When she walked up calle Ronda san Pau towards our hotel she had a similar attack and also clung on to her bag. I just think for a 4 * hotel they should at least have some security outside and sort out the double glazing. I could not sleep as most Spanish people appear to come back from night clubs at around 4am in the morning and the trucks and ambulances go all night. However the bedroom was nice and clean with a modern appearance. Breakfast could have been better and was indeed on the Monay of our departure with all items replenished on the buffet. Next time we will stay closer to the Ramblas in a 2 star hotel and take no handbag. Difficult to carry cameras and mobile phones but body armour might be good.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcotraveller
Reviews.Content: a very good value hotel clean smart helpful staff ! in a great location for walking to la ramblas (10mins) and handy for the metro which is a great cheap way of getting about ! overall a great hotel would reccomend to anyone !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but...”
Reviews.Author: Kowkow_Shanghai
Reviews.Content: We had a four-day trip in Barcelona and we stayed at Apsis. This hotel is renovated and decorated very well. Nice facilities including sauna and a jaccuzi if you make reservations. Great location to the metro station Parelel which covers two metro lines and a ferry to the mountain. Very cute and informative young receptionists (all men) The bad thing is they made terrible mistakes during our stay by giving keycard to strangers who broke into our room at 3 am. Air conditioner does not work according to the temperature you adjust to. It is overwhelmingly hot in the room if you turn on the conditioner all night long!

Reviews.Title: “Mmmm not bad”
Reviews.Author: harrytoro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the first week of Jan and found it to be reasonably well placed in the city. To be honest I am sure there are other hotels in the area that are better located and even cheaper. The rooms are fine and nicely presented- we had a nightmare on the first night as the aircon/heating system was insane, it must have been about 45c all night and it was making a terrible noise, wow i was hallucinating! Tv was rubbish so dont try to watch it, CNN was the only english language and that almost killed us! Wolf Blizter- is that a made-up name? Each night we had to walk along from the hotel to La Rambla and while it was only a short walk the shortest route was through a weird and dodgey ally that had several intimidating parts- no hassle mind but if you are a paranoid person in a city renound for thieving etc then this is not a walk for you. I kinda enjoyed being away from La Rambla and heading off into it for dinner etc. One good thiing about the location is its simple walk to the main port and the waterfront, a nice walk down there during the day is refreshing. Facilities are not bad here, simple but comfortable bathroom and toiletries provided, good electronic safe for passports etc and it's free for a change. they have lovely spa area downstairs, sauna jacuzzi etc- no pool- but it was a booking system that to be honest we didnt bother with as there is so much to do in Barcelona. There is a great roof top "solarium" that you can go out to in the sunshine with reasonable views around the city. Didnt even see the bar area but why would you, plenty of places more interesting near by! Only other thing is we never saw a single other guest, which was kinda weird. Enjoy though, a great city so you cant go too wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: itcheefeet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here late December 2006. This hotel is a great base for exploring the delights of Barcelona being close to the metro and in easy walking distance of The Ramblas, the Gothic Quarter and the harbour area. Like others we were a little unsure of the surrounding area, however, on our many walks to and from the hotel at different hours of the day we encountered no problems. The hotel itself was nothing special, I would agree that it perhaps is not deserving of its 4 star status. Many rooms are quirky in shape (and small), inadequate bathroom ventilation, the heating/air conditioning leaves a bit to be desired. The room service menu consists of half a dozen sandwiches and on the occasion we tried to order we were advised we couldn't have anything as "room service was off sick". We never saw the bar open and the rooms do not have tea/coffee making facilities. We didn't use the TV - we found it only showed Spanish speaking programs, if travelling with children beware. they have pay TV - this includes films and adult films - as you flick through the channels you get a full show for a few seconds before it asks for your confirmation. Think of this hotel as a travelodge (somewhere to put your head) and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “good value - pity about air con and elevator noise”
Reviews.Author: spanishjohnny99
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on the first few days in January. The room was fine and clean but very warm. We asked about the air conditioning and were told they didn't have any. We also had a room beside the elevator and it made a bit of a racket at night! On the upside the staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel is located very close to las ramblas and metro stations. The area around the hotel is a bit dodgy and we did get taxis back at night. Fine during the day though.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was OK, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Pengaman
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 5 staying in 3 rooms at the hotel between Christmas and New Year, December 2006. The hotel is well located being about 5-10 mins walk from La Rambla. The cost was an average of €115/ night for a double room including breakfast which was pretty good considering the city centre location. However I would definitely rate the hotel as 3-star rather than 4-star. The local area is a little seedy but no great problem and we walked to and from the hotel both day and night without any problems. The rooms were OK, spacious, modern and clean though one room was constantly very hot and on our last morning there was no hot water available throughout the hotel. The buffet breakfast is very good but quite expensive at €12 (reduced from €15 if pre-booked) but be warned that if you do pre-book it for your stay you get charged for the breakfast even if you don't take it. There is a tiny bar which we found to be hopeless - not open a lot of the time and not staffed for the remainder. The hotel staff were fine and spoke good English. All-in-all it is an OK hotel but I would like to try somewhere else if I return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “this is a winner”
Reviews.Author: jinxjordan
Reviews.Content: Has a brandnew feel to it. Nicely sized rooms with extremely clean modern marble bathrooms. Wellness center, business center and a good breakfast room. I didn't have breakfast but other guests said it was very good. The hotel has a positive vibe and makes you feel right at home. I have stayed at other places in Barcelona and this was the cleanest and most welcoming. Staff at reception is extremely helpful. They made loads of reservations at restaurants for us, recommended great places and had an answer to every question. They truly made an effort to please. I have stayed in many 5 star first class hotels around the world and even though I dreaded and expected this to be basic, I couldn't find fault with anything here. It isn't the Park Hyatt or the Mandarin Oriental but on a budget is truly the next best thing to it.Everything is brand-new, fast, roomy elevators and good marble staircases in well lighted hallways. The Metro is 200 metres away and the Ramblas in short walking distance. There are cafes and a Kentucky Fried Chicken on the very same street, but why bother when the city is full of delicious Tapas restaurants. All in all Barcelona is choc-full of unfriendly taxi drivers and shop staff who'd rather chew nails than serve you, but the Apsis Milleni was a wonderful place to come home to. It might not be a design hotel and the furniture and carpets in the rooms were a bit dark, but everything else was light, clean and modern. I have paid far more money for other hotels in Barcelona that were nowhere near the standard of the Apsis. Unless I will treat myself to a Design temple next time I will be returning to the Apsis Milleni again and will recommend it to anyone going to Barcelona. It is great value for money and everything looked exactly as it did in the pics. This is a good choice for any trip, may it be business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great value Apsis Milleni”
Reviews.Author: 10-Kilo
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiancee have stayed twice at the Apsis Milleni (once in 2005 and again in 2006), and on both occasions have found it to be clean and efficient, with very helpful english speaking staff. Obviously everyone wants something different from a hotel. I wanted somewhere that was clean, modern, safe, central and cheap! And the Milleni ticks all of those boxes. We didn't take breakfast (€7), but why would you when Barcelona is so full of great little restaurants & cafes. The rooms (I can only speak for the 2 we've stayed in) were very clean and modern, and serviced to a high standard. The only complaint I have (and I really am scraping the barrel here) is that the rooms at the front of the hotel are a bit on the noisy side (they front a main rd, and I dont think the windows are double glazed) Some reveiws posted previously have mentioned the hotels location. OK, its not on the Ramblas - Its 1 stop away on the metro (1 min walk) or a 5 min walk. And the safety of the area? All I can say is that it feels safer than central London or Cork city on a sat night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, great service, nice room, strange shower”
Reviews.Author: aplutzer
Reviews.Content: This was a great location. 1 Block from the Barcelona Metro which also was the stop for the Tram to the Mountain where the Miro Museum is located. They had a marvelous breakfast and was a good value - about 60% of what we paid in Italy (venice and Rome). Guests are entitled to a free day at the jacuzzi and gym in the basement but we didn't have time for it. It was a 15 minute walk to the Rambla and I would have preferred a shorter walk, but you could take the metro if you needed.
